name: Floodplain Water Retention / Storage
functionStatement: Wetlands and storage features store floodwater, recharge groundwater, sustain baseflow, and provide low-velocity habitat.
descriptionMarkdown: Moderate floods (~1-5 yr) reach the floodplain, providing water retention/infiltration per regional norms.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Identify bankfull indicators and recent high-water marks and compare to bankfull elevation. Corroborate with a nearby gage bankfull or recurrence estimate where available.

inputs.label: Floodplain Water Retention / Storage
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence; Cross-section calculation tools

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Floodplain is actively engaged at the local moderate-flood standard (often about 1-2 yr or 2-5 yr). (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Overbanking requires flows slightly larger than typical bankfull, but still not rare. / Overbanking requires 5-10 yr floods. Partial disconnection. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Rarely or never overbanking below about 10+ yr events. Deep incision or levees block moderate floods. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)

references: USFS and NRCS bankfull field guides
